Meadow Park Mobile Estates | 277 Ne Conifer Boulevard, Corvallis, OR 97330 | MHBO.com SEARCH Buy Rent Explore Parks My Property Feed favorite_border Favorites Sign Up or Login COMMUNITY PROFILE Meadow Park Mobile Estates 277 Ne Conifer Boulevard location_on Map It Corvallis, OR 97330 | ID: 76349 hotel_class Review this Park Inquire About Homes Lot Rent Info Inquire About Homes Lot Rent Info 55 + PET FRIENDLY PHOTOS VIDEO STREET VIEW 44.600055 -123.245429 988346 277 Ne Conifer Boulevard, Corvallis, OR 97330 Details Name Meadow Park Mobile Estates Type of community Age-restricted community ? Lot rent range $475 - $725 Office Phone (541) 753-9844 Total # of lots 150 Pet policy check Pet friendly check Pet restrictions apply Two approved pets - Pet restrictions Community owner type Company, privately held Year built 1968 Water type Well Sewer type Septic Street width Wide Parking Off-street Street type Paved Climate Zone Rating MARINE MORE OWNER/MANAGER? CLAIM THIS COMMUNITY Call Us (541) 753-9844 Larry Kampfer input SEND TO MY PHONE About lot rent The lot rent ranges from $475 - $725 per month and includes: check Trash pickup check Water check Sewer Disclaimer Lot rent and other fees can change at any time without notice. MHBO is not responsible for quoting current monthly fees,
          lot rent, or any dues/fees associated with the community or home. Additional fees for certain amenity privileges may apply.
          All applicable community fees are the responsibility of the buyer to obtain and community manager/owner to disclose prior to ownership or occupancy. Description Meadow Park Mobile Estates is an age-restricted (55+) manufactured home community located in 277 Ne Conifer Boulevard, Corvallis, OR 97330. Meadow Park Mobile Estates is a land-lease community was built in 1968. and has a total of 150 home sites. Home site lot rent ranges from $475 - $725 per month and includes the following: Trash pickup Water Sewer The streets in the community are paved, and are of an wide street width. The water in the community is sourced from the well and the sewer system is septic. Parking is off-street The community has 0 parking spaces available for RVs. Meadow Park Mobile Estates is an affordable housing choice for active, friendly, age-qualified living. This well-maintained retirement community has easy access to local recreation, shopping and entertainment. Equal Housing Opportunity Amenities check Billiards check Boat storage check Clubhouse check Recreation facilities check Swimming pool check Library check Sauna check RV Storage Area check Planned Activities check WiFi check On-Site Staff Local Climate MARINE Meadow Park Mobile Estates is located in Climate Zone 4.
        A MARINE climate is defined as a region that receives less than 20 inches (50 cm) of annual precipitation, and where the monthly average outdoor temperature drops below 45 45°F (7°C) during the winter months. Knowing your area’s climate zone (as assigned by the U.S. Department of Energy’s Building America Program into one of eight zones), can help you predict your heating and cooling needs. Humidity and temperature can of course vary, even by county. The Building America MARINE climate zone corresponds to the portions of IECC zones 3 and 4 and located in the “C” moisture category. READ MORE ABOUT CLIMATE ZONES > Inquire about this Community I was searching on MHBO.com and found your community. The data relating to real estate for sale on this website appears in part through the BRIGHT Internet Data Exchange program, a voluntary cooperative exchange of property listing data between licensed real estate brokerage firms in which participates, and is provided by BRIGHT through a licensing agreement. The information provided by this website is for the personal, non-commercial use of consumers and may not be used for any purpose other than to identify prospective properties consumers may be interested in purchasing. Some properties which appear for sale on this website may no longer be available because they are under contract, have Closed or are no longer being offered for sale. Some real estate firms do not participate in IDX and their listings do not appear on this website.  Some properties listed with participating firms do not appear on this website at the request of the seller. This home sale information is not to be construed as an appraisal and may not be used as such for any purpose. BRIGHT MLS is the (or a) provider of this home sale information and has compiled content from various sources. Some properties represented may not have actually sold due to reporting errors. © BRIGHT, All Rights Reserved. All information deemed reliable but not guaranteed. Our community consists of 246 home sites with an on-site office and a playground for children. Downtown Crawfordsville gives that old town feeling and sense of community while still providing a diverse list of industries including RR Donnelley, Random House, Walmart Optical and Crown, Cork & Seal to name a few. Description Highland View Mobile Home Estates is an age-restricted (55+) manufactured home community located in 2655 Nw Highland Drive, Corvallis, OR 97330. Highland View Mobile Home Estates is a land-lease community was built in 1960. and has a total of 130 home sites. Home site lot rent ranges from $475 - $725 per month and includes the following: Trash pickup Water Sewer The streets in the community are paved, and are of an average street width. The water in the community is sourced from the well and the sewer system is septic. Parking is off-street The community has 0 parking spaces available for RVs. Highland View Mobile Home Estates is an affordable housing choice for active, friendly, age-qualified living. This well-maintained retirement community has easy access to local recreation, shopping and entertainment. Equal Housing Opportunity Amenities check Recreation facilities check Sidewalks Local Climate MARINE Highland View Mobile Home Estates is located in Climate Zone 4.
        A MARINE climate is defined as a region that receives less than 20 inches (50 cm) of annual precipitation, and where the monthly average outdoor temperature drops below 45 45°F (7°C) during the winter months. Knowing your area’s climate zone (as assigned by the U.S. Department of Energy’s Building America Program into one of eight zones), can help you predict your heating and cooling needs. Humidity and temperature can of course vary, even by county. The Building America MARINE climate zone corresponds to the portions of IECC zones 3 and 4 and located in the “C” moisture category. About | Imperial Homes Skip to main content Skip to footer +44 (0) 1489 784847 Customer Login Our Developments About Guides Partnerships Our Developments About Guides Partnerships Get in touch About Imperial Homes, with a difference Experience a truly personal service for the most important decision of your life As a smaller developer you’re not simply a number to us and we know how stressful purchasing a new home can be. At Imperial we’re by your side throughout your home buying journey, from helping to find the right property or location for you, to giving you regular updates, guidance and advice beyond your move-in date. 0 Years in business 0 Developments 0 homes High specification homes as standard We know you that you want to love where you live. In order to do that you need a large home on a small development, a place that feels yours through and through. The problem with most new developments is that they are comprised of sprawling characterless estates that don’t cater for your discerning taste, leaving you feeling frustrated by the lack of choice available to you. Our ethos We believe buying a new home on a small development should be an option available to everyone. Your home should be something your proud of, that’s why we only buy small developments with the highest specification, along with choices on specific additional extras. Characterful, precisely designed and expertly crafted properties that you can make your home for years to come, whatever your requirements. Find your home Years in business Buying a new home with Imperial Homes couldn't be simpler Choose your home from our current developments across the South Coast. Enjoy your journey to completion with a highly personable service and regular updates. Relax in your spacious new home on your small and perfectly formed development. Speak to us today Our friendly team are always on hand to help with everything you need. Hassle-free advice, buying guidance and more. get in touch +44 (0) 1489 784847 Meet our team With Imperial Homes you’ll find a team of experts who truly care about your journey and experience. You’ll get a greater sense of community, a personalised experience and regular updates with your own portal. Joe began his construction career in 1999, his portfolio reads as an impressive catalogue of successful projects ranging from domestic extensions through to multi-million pound housing schemes. This experience allowed him to co-found Imperial Homes in 2013. Joe Director Richard boasts an impressive 22-year career in the industry, with his roots in Housing Associations. Richard has been able to nurture these relationships in order to add a significant yearly build programme of affordable homes and procure numerous developments for the private market. Richard Director Ben joined in December 2019 bringing extensive knowledge in his field, making him an expert in sourcing and unlocking land, negotiating contracts and delivering new developments. He has a truly natural ability to develop and strengthen the all-important landowner relationships. Ben Director Leigah has been with Imperial Homes since the very beginning fresh from an accountancy firm joining us as Finance Director. An integral part of the business overseeing the smooth financial running of the company. Leigah Finance Director Chris joined Imperial Homes in June 2020 as a Site Manager with 18 years of experience with national and regional developers, quickly showing an interest in progression. In 2021 Chris was promoted to Construction Director, overseeing our site team and developments. Chris Construction Director Having been a qualified accountant for the last 6 years, she has fast become an asset to Imperial Homes since joining in 2022. . Hollie Accounts manager In 2021, Melanie joined us as Sales Manager having had over 20 years of experience as a sales negotiator with national new homes developers across London and the South Coast. She quickly expanded her role into marketing taking over the company’s website and social media. Melanie Sales and Marketing manager After finishing university in Croatia, Marina started her career in finance before moving to the UK for an accounting role, becoming a surveyor in 2023 for a shop fitting company and eventually joining Imperial Homes in 2024. She is currently studying for a degree in Quantity Surveying. Marina Quantity Surveyor Katie joined us in 2023 from a background in hospitality and time travelling the world. As office manager her role is varied across the business, looking after the day to day running. Katie Office manager In 2018, Rob joined Imperial Homes as a valued member of the customer care team, his skill and attention to detail contributes to the quality of our homes. Rob Customer Care Manager Mitch is an invaluable member of the team. Overseeing development logistics for the business as early as 2015. Mitch greets everyone he meets with a smile; nothing is too much trouble. Mitch Logistics Manager Joining Imperial Homes in 2018 with a wealth of experience, Dave is our most experienced site manager, often taking on the challenge of our most difficult builds. Dave Senior Site Manager Huw has a strong construction background as a carpenter, making for a natural career progression into management. Joining us in 2020 as a Site Manager from a national property developer. Huw Senior Site Manager In 2019, Joel joined Imperial Homes as an apprentice. With a background in plumbing, he quickly worked his way to Assistant Site Manager before being proudly promoted to Site Manager in 2022. Joel Site Manager With a history in property and facilities maintenance across large accommodation buildings, Chris joined us in 2021 as an Assistant Site Manager. Chris has shown himself to be a fast learner, looking after the completion of a complicated development as his first project for Imperial Homes. Kate TRAINEE SITE MANAGER Discover the charm of the South Coast with Imperial Homes At Imperial Homes, we believe that a home is not just a place to live, but a gateway to a lifestyle enriched by stunning landscapes, vibrant communities, and unique local culture. Our thoughtfully designed developments span across the breath taking landscape of the South Coast of England. From the likes of the historic charm of Chichester to the picturesque beauty of Fordingbridge. The South Coast Nature at your doorstep A desirable lifestyle Living along the South Coast means embracing a lifestyle that beautifully blends nature, history, and community. With its rolling hills, sandy beaches, and thriving local towns, this region is a haven for those who appreciate both serenity and vibrancy. Whether you’re exploring the ancient woodlands of the South Downs National Park or enjoying the fresh air of the New Forest, every day presents an opportunity to connect with the natural beauty that surrounds you. Our locations provide easy access to some of the most breathtaking landscapes in the UK. The South Downs National Park boasts miles of walking and cycling trails, inviting you to immerse yourself in its tranquil beauty. Meanwhile, the New Forest offers a unique ecosystem teeming with wildlife and ancient woodlands—perfect for weekend adventures or quiet retreats. The South Coast is not just about scenic views; it’s about a community-oriented lifestyle. Enjoy a range of local amenities, from farmers’ markets of Romsey to the boutique shops in Winchester and indulge in the diverse culinary scene that features everything from cosy pubs to gourmet restaurants. Families, professionals, and retirees alike find the perfect blend of relaxation and excitement in this vibrant region. Join Us in Building Your Dream Home At Imperial Homes, we’re dedicated to creating smaller developments that celebrate the unique character of the South Coast. Our commitment to quality craftsmanship and thoughtful design ensures that your new home will be a place of comfort and style. Experience the beauty and desirability of life on the South Coast— where every day feels like a holiday. Find your home Our Journey A 11-Year Legacy of Growth and Commitment In the ever-evolving landscape of the construction and property development industry, Imperial Homes has carved out a remarkable niche since 2013. Founded by Joe Dorrington, whose roots in construction run deep thanks to his father’s expertise in groundworks, the company began its journey with a single property earmarked for refurbishment. Little did they know that this initial venture would lay the groundwork for a thriving business. The Humble Beginnings Imperial Homes started with a vision: to transform properties and create beautiful living spaces. Joe, driven by a passion for construction and a commitment to quality, recognized the potential of that first property. With determination and hard work, the first new build site was established , comprising two homes that set the standard for the developments to come. This marked the beginning of a journey fuelled by ambition and a desire to make a difference in the community. Key Milestones in Growth As the years rolled on, Imperial Homes steadily gained momentum. By 2017, the company welcomed Richard Paine as a director. With his extensive background in fostering partnerships between developers and housing associations like Vivid, Richard brought a wealth of experience that proved invaluable. His insight into strategic collaborations not only expanded Imperial Homes’ reach but also enhanced its reputation as a trustworthy developer. In 2019, the company took another significant step forward with the addition of Ben Olds as Land Director. Ben’s expertise in securing prime land opportunities allowed Imperial Homes to build a robust land bank, enabling them to pursue stunning developments that resonate with both current market demands and community needs. His vision helped ensure that each new project aligned with the company’s commitment to quality and sustainability. A Trajectory of Growth With the leadership of Joe, Richard, and Ben, Imperial Homes has undergone remarkable growth over the past 11 years. The company has evolved from its modest beginnings into a respected player in the property development sector, known for its dedication to craftsmanship and community-oriented designs. Imperial Homes remains dedicated to preserving the charm and character of their smaller developments. Each project is approached with an understanding that homes are not just structures, but spaces where families create memories and communities thrive. This philosophy has guided the company’s efforts to develop properties that are both beautiful and functional, ensuring that they meet the needs of the people who will inhabit them. Looking Ahead As Imperial Homes continues to grow, the focus remains on building lasting relationships, both within the industry and with the communities they serve. The company is excited about the future, with plans to expand its portfolio while maintaining the integrity and craftsmanship that have become its hallmark.
